title: Web camera control for WPF
body: Here in WPF, we still don't have a good way of previewing video and capturing frames from web cameras. Me personally, I have written a C++ library that utilizes Windows Media Foundation, renders a captured sample to IDirect3DSurface9 and sends it back to WPF user control, where this surface becomes a back buffer of D3DImage, but it's not so easy and sometimes is not so fast.

comments.body: You can use WinRT api's.  Taking advantage of WinRT within your WPF application will dramatically simplify things like upnp, Bluetooth, webcam, etc.
